intro: Arracacia montana, commonly known as the mountain arracacha, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are used in traditional medicine and as a vegetable in some regions. Arracacia montana thrives in cool, high-altitude environments and is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils.
